Name: Scarab
Description: Steatite scarab with detailed cutting of head and legs, but not of wing-cases on the back. This style is typical of 2nd Intermediate Period scarabs, as is the cutting of the motif on the underside, showing a scarab beetle with sun-disk between the front legs. The movement of the sun through the sky was paralleled by the scarab pushing its eggs in a ball of dung along the ground; the hatching of the eggs from the ball provided an analogy with the daily rebirth of the sun on the eastern horizon at dawn.
